content.description:
This route was solo'd, so the pro is uncertain, although the static line can easily be used as protection if you so wish. A good method for getting to the top of the cliff. Still a bit loose and dirty.

Just left of an obvious large, wide roof and just to the right of the rappel line is a gully at the top of a large mound of dirt. 15' up there is a static line to hand over hand up if you wish.
don't know?

This route is located on the right most wall of the lower tier. Begin 6m left of the prominent off-width/chimney in a short, left-facing corner below the large horizontal ledge/cave. Climb a short crack to reach a large ledge. Move right on the ledge and head straight up above the stumps. (The 5.8 rating accounts for using the stumps, when these are gone the route may be a bit more difficult.) Move right again on the next ledge and head straight up to the anchors located on a large protuding block at the top of the cliff. For the full-value finish one-arm hang, and chalk up off the protuding block Right end of lower tier, first route to the left of the obvious offwidth/chimney Sport (8 Bolts)
2 Bolt Anchor with Rap Rings

Start on a blank, high angle slab near the middle of the main wall. At the top of the cliff, there are two blocks that stick out which have a crack running right between them. This climb is about 10-15' left of these blocks. Climb up through a series of horizontals and overlaps.

6 bolts 2 rap rings

climbs.name: Baloo
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Josh Shewbridge, Brittany Gionet

content.description:
An easy start leads to a very crimpy technical face under a roof. A few insecure moves under the roof leads to a final crux up to the chains. Not the best route at bear mountian but provides short cruxs  and good rests

Just left of the escape gully
Bolts

Start up the first move of deception dike then traverse right across a flaring horizontal handcrack gaining a good foot ledge. Then head stright up through some easier climbing then pulling a final weird crux finishing at an anchor. 
 After clipping the 4th bolt you reach down and unclip the 3rd bolt to prevent rope drag.

Far right end of the the bottom tier. Just right of deception dike.
7 bolts, 2 rap rings

climb up funky featured rock through several horizontals to the anchors. A great bald hill moderate that is a great way to get used to the techniques needed for bald hill climbing.

In the middle of the lower cliff, at the highest point of ground,
4 bolts and rap rings

This route is located on the lower tier 10 metres left of the access gully. Climb to the right of the bolted line to reach a large bulge and continue up the left arÃªte of the bulge to the anchor. 10 m left of access gully Sport (8 Bolts)
2 Bolt Anchor with Rap Rings

At the far right end of the main wall is a right trending dike which looks like a 5.6. The dike becomes very faint at the end and a difficult top-out variation is possible. Very nice climbing until the ridiculously hard last move to pull over the top (mono-sloper-sidepull-highstep-hand-foot-match-mantle-dyno anyone?) The first route climbed at Bald Hill. A possible exit may also go out left to a crack. 
 Description by P.J Adamson

the far right side of the lower tier.
6 bolts and 2 rap rings

climbs.name: The Dragon's Reign
climbs.fa: FA: J.Adamson, A.Dunphey FFA: C.Hall, J.Adamson

content.description:
Locate the dragon shaped hold at the lip of the roof which cuts the bottom of the entire wall. Pull the roof over the dragon's head (careful! It's too cool to break off), making several campus moves out right. Traverse right through the easiest weakness in the wall then up a vertical crack. Rap my other woman is a hand crack.

left side of the lower cliff.
Standard Rack

Near the right end of the cliff is an obvious corner with a very wide crack in it. Follow it up, then traverse left to the roof and then straight up to the top

The right end of the lower tier
bolts and ring anchor, a little run out at the start.

Move up easy climbing to a somewhat high first bolt. Pull past the roof into the vertical flake. Make another strenuous move at the second bolt, then continue more easily, Â following the flake then trending right on sloping features to a stance below the upper roof. Pull through this roof (crux) and gain better holds. Easy run-out climbing to the anchor.



Between McPeck ArÃªte and Face the Pockets is a vertical offwidth/gully. This is a good landmark. Grandma Butt is the second route left of that gully. Look for vertical flakes on the middle portion of the route.

4 bolts. Rap Rings

Climb the short offwidth found at the very right end of the lower tier. Continue up the tight chimney until you can exit right onto a ledge. Move up to the next ledge and step back across the chimney and up to the final large ledge with a bolted anchor. Far right end of Lower Tier Natural Pro. A BD #4 was helpful for the offwidth.
2 bolt anchor with rap rings.

Pull onto a groove-like slab depression, then big balancy moves between slopers and crimps will bring you over the multiple bulges that form this route.

the far right end of the lower tier.
8 bolts and 2 rap rings

A nice little crack climb left of Industrial Gunk, this climb takes good pro and finishes with a height dependent crux.

Far left end of the lower cliff.
standard Rack

Climb through the roof at the left side of the totem, and follow pockets and horizontals up to the rap rings.

far left end on the lower tier.
all the placements are in horizontals, small to med cams.

This route is located by the right hand arete of The Dragon's Reign wall (just left of My Other Woman is a Handcrack). Begin in a short chimney that is capped with an overhanging block which forms twin cracks at the top of the chimney. Pull over this block onto the large ledge. Traverse the horizontal left of the ledge to reach good flakes. Climb the flakes to get to a series of horizontals. Use the horizontals to continue traversing left until it is possible to top out onto the large ledge. Just left of My Other Woman is a Handcrack Natural Pro
2 Bolt Anchor

climbs.name: Loose Moose
climbs.fa: Fa: Jon & Pj adamson FFA: Ian Lingley, Eric Fox

content.description:
First bolt can be stick clipped or requires one blanacey move. Follow crips and flakes past another bolt and gear placements. Finishes at a two bolt anchor. lower level just to the right of "my other woman.." 2 bolts + gear. rap rings

There is an optional gear placement under the roof.

A funky zig-zag line that has 2 cruxes. A better description will be giving soon.

Sport bolts and hangers.

Locate the wide crack that separates the middle and right end of the lower tier cliff. Start up the crack but break out right about 5' up onto the face/arete, thin balancy moves will get you through the technical crux, then it a pump fest through slopers and flaring cracks to the top.

right end of the lower tier.
5 bolts with 2 rap rings

climbs.name: My Other Woman is a Hand Crack

content.description:
Sort of lightning bolt crack on the left wall of a right-facing corner beneath a small roof. Start on a large ledge about 5' up. Will be extremely nice after some more cleaning.

Near, but not quite at the farthest left wall of the main cliff.
standard Rack

Start 10' right of assimilation, right below the two overhanging blocks at the top. Climb past the 1'st bolt and place a cam (very much optional) in the horizontal. Go past a lone chickenhead and another bolt. Traverse left at the 3rd bolt and continue up past more bolts to a 2-bolt anchor

optional yellow master cam or yellow c3 between 1st and 2ed.

Located on the right end of the lower tier between Toad in the Hole and Rocky Road. Difficult start up a crimpy ramp leads to a slopey horizontal crack and easier climbing to a ledge. From the ledge, engage the crux by using a crimp shared with the neighbouring route Toad - the only shared handhold on the route - and make very tenuous moves up bulges to the anchor. Stick-clipping is very strongly recommended. Between Toad in the Hole and Rocky Road. Sport (6 Bolts)
Anchor with Quickclips

Climb straight up to a half moon scoop feature, and continue up to a large horizontal crack. Traverse a little left and head straight up through easier terrain to the anchors.

Found 20' to the right of the large split blocks at the top of the main cliff.
bolts, 2 rap rings

start under a small, left facing corner. Climb slab to gain horizontals then up to anchors. A great introductory bald hill moderate.

Just to the right of the highest point of ground in the middle of the main/lower cliff
6 bolts and rap rings.

This route is a bit of a variation starting at rocky road and following the right trending dike across 4 routes, crossing grovin deception dike and finishing on bear the Flare. A unique route and will test your route reading ability

Starting on rocky road and finishing on bear the Flare
Mostly bolts and a standard rack of cams

climbs.name: Rocky Road
climbs.fa: FA: P.Adamson, S.Adamson, J.Adamson, G.Bachman FFA: J.Adamson, S.Adamson 2009.05.19

content.description:
Found 15Â right of ÂToad In The HoleÂ, climb up a series of horizontals and overlaps all the way to the top. First bolt is a stick-clip.

the far right side of the lower tier.
7 bolts, and 2 rap rings

This route is X rated whether you do it on toprope or lead. Climb up the first 15' of the access gully, then break right to end up underneath the left side of the roof. Pull out from underneath the overhang onto the extremely aesthetic flake and continue to the top. The solidness of the flake is somewhat less than confidence inspiring, but it hasn't failed us yet.

Make sure your belayer (and anyone else) is off the side, helmets might be good.

Make a hard mantle, and continue up through overlaps to a right slanting dike. Follow the dike to a large horizontal. Traverse back left and surmount the final bulge to the anchors. An excellent and challenging route the entire way.

20' right of the large roof on the main wall, start below sloping shelves.
10 bolts and rap rings

Climb the blank bolted line 5m left of My Other Woman is a Handcrack

First bolted route to the right of Dragon's Reign
Sport (6 bolts)

Start on the obvious hueco (the toad hole) at head height and follow the bolts passed crimps and horizontals. Fantastic sport climb that will take a a couple small cams at the bottom and the top if you feel the need. on the far right side of the lower tier. 4 bolts and 2 rap rings
There is the option to place small gear between the 1st and 2ed and also at the top of the climb as well.

The bottom cliff houses the best and highest concentrated of hard sport climbs in NB. The routes on the lower cliff are a mix between horizontals, slopers and fantastic one of a kind features that make every route a classic.
